site_name: Chessington World Of Adventures Resort, Petting Zoo
description: Development of a replacement themed land including demolition of existing buildings/structures and installation of rides (plant and machinery) with ancillary structures and kiosks, new buildings, infrastructure, landscaping and associated works.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Prior to the commencement of development hereby approved (excluding demolition and site establishment), a Biodiversity Gain Plan shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The Biodiversity Gain Plan shall be prepared in accordance with the Ecological Appraisal (Dec 2024) prepared by Baker associates and the Statutory Biodoversity Metric (December 2024) on the area shown in plan 6071-OOB-ZZ-00-D-L-000080 Rev P01 or any alternative area. The biodiversity gain plan must include:information about the steps taken or to be taken to minimise the adverse effect of the development on the biodiversity of the onsite habitat and any other habitat;the pre-development biodiversity value of the onsite habitat;the post-development biodiversity value of the onsite habitat;any registered offsite biodiversity gain allocated to the development and the biodiversity and the biodiversity value of that gain in relation to the development;any biodiversity credits purchased for the development; andany such other matters as the Secretary of State may by regulations specify.Reason: To ensure the development delivers a biodiversity net gain on site in accordance with Schedule 7A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Prior to the commencement of development hereby approved (excluding demolition and site establishment), a Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan, prepared in accordance with the approved Biodiversity Gain Plan and including the below matters, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority:The  Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan must include: a non-technical summary;the roles and responsibilities of the people or organisation(s) delivering the Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan;the planned habitat creation and enhancement works to create or improve habitat to achieve the biodiversity net gain in accordance with the approved Biodiversity Gain Plan;the management measures to maintain habitat in accordance with the approved Biodiversity Gain Plan for a period of 30 years from the completion of development; andthe monitoring methodology and frequency in respect of the created or enhanced habitat to be submitted to the local planning authority, to include submission of monitoring reports. Reason: To ensure the development delivers a biodiversity net gain on site in accordance with Schedule 7A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Prior to installation of any external lighting, lighting details shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The external lighting shall be installed in accordance with the approved details and thereby retained as such unless a variation is subsequently submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, and in order to protect the

Notice in writing shall be given to the Council when the:Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan has been implemented; andhabitat creation and enhancement works as set out in the Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan have been completed.The created and/or enhanced habitat specified in the approved Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan shall be managed and maintained in accordance with the approved Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan for the agreed time period.Reason: To ensure the development delivers a biodiversity net gain on site in accordance with Schedule 7A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development shall not be occupied or brought into usethe habitat creation and enhancement works set out in the approved Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan have been completed; and a completion report, evidencing the completed habitat enhancements, has been submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.The created and/or enhanced habitat specified in the approved Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan shall be managed and maintained in accordance with the approved Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan.Reason: To ensure the development delivers a biodiversity net gain on site in accordance with Schedule 7A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The planting proposals shall be carried out in accordance with plans 6071-OOB-ZZ-00-D-L-000001 Rev P04, 6071-OOB-ZZ-00-D-L-000010 Rev P02, 6071-OOB-ZZ-00-D-L-000040 Rev P02, 6071-OOB-ZZ-00-D-L-000070 Rev P02 and 6071-OOB-ZZ-00-D-L-000080 Rev P01 which shall be completed by the end of the next available planting season immediately following the completion of the development or the site being brought into use, whichever is the earliest.Any trees or shrubs which die, are removed or become diseased during this period shall be replaced during the following planting season, and the areas shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose. Alterations to the landscaping scheme must be agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding the proposed hours of operation stated within the CONSTRUCTION & ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT PLAN (December 2024), the site and building works required to implement the development shall be only carried out between the hours of 08.00 and 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 and 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers

No demolition, site clearance or building operations shall be commenced until tree protection to the standards set out in BS5837: 2005 "Protection of Trees on Construction Sites" (figures 4 and 5) has been erected around the trees shown on the approved Tree Protection Plan (2365- KC-CZ-YTREE-TPPO1 Rev 0) as being retained on the site.Such tree protection shall be maintained during the course of development, and no storage, site structures, parking or any other operation shall be permitted within the area thereby protected. Within the protected area:(a) levels shall not be raised or lowered in relation to the existing ground level,(b) no roots shall be cut, trenches dug, or soil removed or drains and services laid,(c) no buildings, site huts, roads or other engineering operations shall be constructed or carried out,(d) no vehicles shall be driven over the area,(e) no materials or equipment shall be stored,(f) and the destruction by burning of any materials shall not take place on the site or adjoining land unless the fires are at a minimum distance from the protected area of 6 metresReason: These details are required prior to commencement of development because the relevant works would take place at the beginning of the construction phase and must be implemented at the outset and to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development and to protect the existing trees on site, in accordance with policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Design details for the theming to be applied to the buildings and elsewhere on the site as indicated on the approved drawings shall be submitted to and approved by the Council prior to installation of the themed features. The design information shall include details of the proposed external appearance including external materials and colour finish. The theming feature shall then be installed in accordance with the approved design and materials.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012

No building/structures hereby permitted shall be occupied or brought into use until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the approved details. A maintenance plan that shows what maintenance tasks will be completed, how often the maintenance tasks will be completed and who shall be responsible for the maintenance of the proposed drainage system should be provided. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. Reason: To comply with the National Planning Policy Framework (Paragraph 182), the London Plan (Policies SI 12 and SI 13) along with associated guidance to these policies and Kingston Council's Core Strategy Policy DM4.

The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures in the approved CEMP (December 2024), which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to commencement of any above ground work (excluding demolition), the applicant must submit to the Local Planning Authority for approval a final drainage layout that confirms the invert level of the proposed discharge point, permeable porous areas and proposed storage volume of the rainwater harvesting tank. The system shall be implemented and thereafter managed and maintained in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with relevant policy requirements including but not limited to NPPF and London Plan Policy SI 13.

Construction and operational noise levels shall not exceed those set out in the Noise Impact Assessment (December 2024), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
